fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2022e3.equipments.heater.test

Class ThermostatedHeaterUser

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2022e3.equipments.heater.test.ThermostatedHeaterUser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI

    public class ThermostatedHeaterUser
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
    The class ThermostatedHeaterUser implements user actions in a test of the thermostated heater.

    Description

    This component illustrates another way to implement user behaviours, by directly scheduling user actions as tasks to be executed on a schedulable pool of threads. Hence, the scheduling must be aligned with the simulation time, the reason why he component needs to access the same accelerated clock as the one used by other components and simulators in the run.

    The component connects to the ThermostatedHeater and, during its execution, it switches on the heater, sets its target temperature and then wait for the given duration before switching off the heater.

    White-box Invariant

     invariant       heaterInboundPortURI != null && !heaterInboundPortURI.isEmpty()
 invariant       duration > 0
 invariant       clockURI != null && !clockURI.isEmpty()

    Black-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2022-11-02

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
